wheat/barley/oats
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

to scold/to beat

General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
pinyin: Dao4 ge2 la1 si1 · Mai4 ke4 a1 se4

sentences.english: When the MacArthur hit, I was behind in the rent.
sentences.chinese: 当初获得麦克阿瑟奖时，我还有租金要还。

sentences.english: That is no doubt true for the backstreet forgers around MacArthur Park.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟地区的伪造者也会因此而无法伪造。

sentences.english: MacArthur Ob/Gyn uses software developed by Sage Healthcare.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟妇产医院使用圣人保健公司研发的软件。

sentences.english: He promptly directed the highest promotions and decorations for general macarthur.
sentences.chinese: 他授予麦克阿瑟将军以最高的官阶和勋奖。

sentences.english: The MacArthur Foundation won't tell what it takes to be rewarded.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟基金不会告诉人们如何才能得到奖金。

sentences.english: Stallman was awarded a MacArthur Foundation fellowship in 1990.
sentences.chinese: 1990年，斯多尔曼被授予麦克阿瑟基金会奖金。

sentences.english: For that, Obama said his favorite was MacArthur's, on the West Side.
sentences.chinese: 对此奥巴马说他最喜欢的是西区的麦克阿瑟餐厅。
麦克阿瑟将军皱着眉头。

sentences.english: MacArthur gave the marchers 20 minutes to vacate.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟给抗议者们20分钟时间撤离。

sentences.english: Truman didn’t allow MacArthur time to stage a grandiose resignation.
sentences.chinese: 杜鲁门没有给麦克阿瑟庄严辞职的机会。

sentences.english: Aber General Macarthur erwähnte den Krieg mit keinem Wort.
sentences.chinese: 可是麦克阿瑟将军却一个字也没有提到战争。

sentences.english: General macarthur was working westward along the north coast of new guinea .
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟将军正在沿着新几内亚北岸向西进军。

sentences.english: General Macarthur klopfte ihr auf die Schulter.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟将军拍着她的肩膀。

sentences.english: STEVE EMBER: In this newsreel, we hear General MacArthur accepting the surrender of the Japanese Empire.
sentences.chinese: 纪录片中能听到麦克阿瑟将军接受日本天皇的投降。

sentences.english: Most recently, he was awarded the first-ever MacArthur Award for International Justice.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他第一个获得“麦克阿瑟国际公正奖”。

sentences.english: Macarthur staged a massive amphibious landing behind enemy lines.
sentences.chinese: 麦克阿瑟在敌后布置了大批的两栖登陆部队。

definition: Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
pinyin: Dao4 ge2 la1 si1 · Mai4 ke4 a1 se4

allied forces
YAMAMOTO Isoroku (1884-1943), Japanese admiral
Adolf Hitler (1889-1945)
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
Wedemeyer (name)/Albert Coady Wedemeyer (1897-1989), US Army commander
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
commander/officer in charge
(Claire) Chennault, commander of Flying Tigers during World War II
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Atchison or Acheson (name)/Atchison city on Missouri in Kansas, USA
Nazi Germany (1933-1945)
